lavaca.mvc.Route.name: lavaca.mvc.Route
lavaca.mvc.Route.extends:
lavaca.util.Disposable
A relationship between a URL pattern and a controller action

params.name: pattern
params.description:
The route URL pattern
  Route URL patterns should be in the form /path/{foo}/path/{*bar}.
  The path variables, along with query string parameters, will be passed
  to the controller action as a params object. In this case, when passed
  the URL /path/something/path/1/2/3?abc=def, the params object would be
  {foo: 'something', bar: [1, 2, 3], abc: 'def'}.

params.name: TController

classitems.description: Re-renders the view's template and replaces the DOM nodes that match the selector argument. If no selector argument is provided, the whole view will be re-rendered. If the first parameter is passed as false the resulting html will pe passed with the promise and nothing will be replaced. Note: the number of elements that match the provided selector must be identical in the current markup and in the newly rendered markup or else the returned promise will be rejected. Re-renders the view's template using the view's model and redraws the entire view

elements that match the specified selector string.

be exactly the same in the view's current markup and in the newly rendered

nothing will be redrawn.

the entire view will be redrawn. If shouldRedraw is false, nothing will be redrawn,

the caller to attach a success handler to the returned promise and define their own
redrawing behavior.

params.description: A hash of the delegates, event types, and handlers that will be bound when the view is rendered. The map should be in the form {delegate: {eventType: callback}}. For example, {'.button': {click: onClickButton}}. The events defined in [[Lavaca.fx.Animation]] and [[Lavaca.fx.Transition]] are also supported. To map an event to the view's el, use 'self' as the delegate. To map events to the view's model, use 'model' as the delegate. To limit events to only a particular property on the model, use a period-seperated syntax such as {model: {'change.myproperty': myCallback}}

classitems.description:
Helper function, exposed in dust templates, that uses
  [Lavaca.util.Translation] to get localized strings.
Accessed as:

<dl>

<dt>{@msg key="code"/}</dt>
  <dd>code—The key under which the message is stored</dd>

<dt>{@msg key="code"}default{/msg}</dt>
  <dd>code—The key under which the message is stored</dd>
  <dd>default—The default markup to display if no translation
      is found</dd>


<dt>{@msg key="code" locale="en_US"/}</dt>
  <dd>code—The key under which the message is stored</dd>
  <dd>locale—The locale from which to get the message ("en_US")</dd>

<dt>{@msg key="code" p0="first" p1=variable /}</dt>
  <dd>code—The key under which the message is stored</dd>
  <dd>p0, p1, … pN—String format parameters for the message
      (See [[Lavaca.util.StringUtils]].format())</dd>

</dl>

classitems.description:
Helper function, exposed in dust templates, that allows templates
  to use data from [[Lavaca.util.Config]]. Accessed as:

<dl>

<dt>{@config key="config_value"/}</dt>
  <dd>key—The key to read from the config file for the default environment.</dd>

<dt>{@config key="config_value" environment="production"/}</dt>
  <dd>key—The key to read from the config file for the specified environment.</dd>

<dt>{@config key="config_value"}default{/config}</dt>
  <dd>key—The key to read from the config file</dd>
  <dd>default—The default markup to display if the key
      is not found</dd>

<dt>{@config key="config_value" p0="first" p1=variable /}</dt>
  <dd>key—The key to read from the config file</dd>
  <dd>p0, p1, … pN—String format parameters
      (See [[Lavaca.util.StringUtils]].format())</dd>

</dl>

<dt>{@config only="local"}…{:else}…{/config}</dt>
  <dd>only—Only render the body content if the current config environment's name matches this key</dd>

</dl>

<dt>{@config not="production"}…{:else}…{/config}</dt>
  <dd>not—Only render the body content if the current config environment's name does NOT match this key</dd>

</dl>

classitems.description:
Object containing the functions used by each date format code. Default format codes are:
d
Day of month (1 - 31)
dd
Padded day of month (01 - 31)
ddd
Abbreviated day of week (Sun - Sat)
ddd
Full day of week (Sunday - Saturday)
f
Tenth of a second
ff
Hundreth of a second
fff
Milliseconds
h
Twelve-hour clock hour (1 - 12)
hh
Padded twelve-hour clock hour (01 - 12)
H
Twenty-four hour clock hour (0 - 23)
HH
Padded twenty-four hour clock hour (00 - 23)
m
Minute (0 - 59)
mm
Padded minute (00 - 59)
M
Month (1 - 12)
MM
Padded month (01 - 12)
MMM
Abbreviated month (Jan - Dec)
MMMM
Full month (January - December)
s
Second (0 - 59)
ss
Padded second (00 - 59)
t
Abbreviated AM/PM designator (A or P)
tt
Full AM/PM designator (AM or PM)
y
Short year (0 - 99)
yy
Padded short year (00 - 99)
yyy
Full year padded to at least 3 digits (000+)
yyyy
Full year padded to at least 4 digits (0000+)
z
Hours offset from UTC (-12, 0, 12)
zz
Padded hours offset from UTC (-12, 00, 12)
zzz
Padded hours and minute offset from UTC (-12:00, 00:00, 12:00)
To add a custom format code, assign this property an object containing an i function (responsible for parsing) and an o function (responsible for stringifying). The i function should assign to one of the following properties of its second argument: date, month, year, hour, minute, second, ms, or offset. Example: Lavaca.util.DateUtils.fn.QQQ = {i: function(input, dateObj, mappedObj) { dateObj.date = parseInt(input, 10); }, o: function(date, utc) { return (utc ? date.getUTCDate() : date.getDate()).toString(); }};
